DecodeLocalPicture BarcodeType Template Name:> Barcode Format: OneD Expected Barcodes Count: Timeout: DeblurLevel: Anti-Damage Level: Text Filter Mode: Region Predetection Mode: Scale Down Threshold: Colour Image Convert Mode: Barcode Invert Mode: Gray Equalization Sensitivity: Texture Detection Sensitivity: Binarization Block Size: Localization Algorithm Priority: Max Dim Of Full Image As 
Barcode Zone: Max Barcodes Count: Enable Fill Binary Vacancy: CODE_39 CODE_128 CODE_93 CODABAR ITF EAN_13 EAN_8 UPC_A UPC_E INDUSTRIAL_25 AZTEC ConnectedBlock Lines Statistics FullImageAsBarcodeZone Best Coverage General Scan Overlap Panorma One-off scan to find at least 1 barcode One-off scan with a thorough search Continuous scan; filter duplicates Advanced mode with all the possible settings Continuous scan; stitch video frames Customized Add Now Start to scan some barcodes You have no files SimpleSettingActivity Scan in single frame with the default settings of our SDK. Scan in single frame with the best efforts of our SDK. Scan in multiple frames with the best efforts of our SDK. This mode works the best for multiple barcodes on 1 image. All barcode results will be added up and saved to history. With this advanced mode, you get to know Dynamsoft Barcode Reader SDK with its flexible decode settings. Both single-frame and multi-frame scanning is supported. The expected number of barcodes to read for each image (0 represents at least 1 barcode) Sets the maximum amount of time (in milliseconds) it should spend searching for a barcode per page. Higher deblur level will reach a better deblur ability during decoding. More localization algorithm will be used in the case of a higher anti-damage level. Whether to filter text to obtain a clearer image for decoding. Whether to pre-detect existing region for barcodes search. Sets the threshold value of the image shrinking. If the shorter edge size is larger than the given value, the library will calculate the required height and width of the barcode image and shrink the image to that size before localization. Otherwise, it will perform barcode localization on the original image. Sets whether to convert colour images to grayscale which is used in region pre-detection. The ink colour for barcodes search. Sets the sensitivity used for gray equalization. The higher the value, the more likely gray equalization will be activated. Effective for images with low comparison between black and white colour. May cause adverse effect on images with high level of black and white colour comparison. The higher value you set, the more efforts it will take to detect texture. Set the block size for the process of binarization. Block size means the size of a pixel neighborhood that is used to calculate a threshold value for the pixel. Sets the priority of localization algorithms to decide the ordering of the following four localization algorithms. Sets the maximum number of barcodes to read. This will limit the number of barcodes returned by library. Sets whether to enable fill binary vacancy. If multi frame: Whether to scan barcode in multi-frame modes. Whether to beep once a barcode is found. Please modify the settings below according to your usage scenario and click on "Done" to scan barcode. Mode:
